p: A. absinthium exhibits effective antifungal and antibacterial activities. Numerous studies have shown the sensitivity of various microorganisms to the compounds contained in A. absinthium. Among them are bacteria such as: Arthrobacter spp., Bacillus cereus, B. mycoides, B. subtilis, Clostridium perfringens, Enterobacter aerogenes, Enterococcus faecalis, Escherichia coli, Haemophilus influenzae, Klebsiella oxytoca, K. pneumoniae, Listeria monocytogenes, Micrococcus lylae, Proteus mirabilis, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Shigella sonnei, Staphylococcus aureus and the fungi: Aspergillus niger, Candida albicans, Fusarium culmorum, F. graminearum, F. moniliforme, F. oxysporum fs. lycopersici, F. sambucinum, F. solani, Rhizoctonia solani, Saccharomyces cerevisiae var. chevalieri, Sclerotinia sp. Extracts from the plant are particularly effective against Gram-positive bacteria. Gram-negative bacteria have greater resistance, which is associated with the presence of an outer phospholipid membrane that serves as an additional protective barrier of these microorganisms [ 16].
